Reviews.Title: The best value in ultraportable touchscreen Windows 8 laptops released in 2013
Reviews.Author: George Kramer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a tablet for my Dad to replace his defunct laptop. Primary use would be to Skype with his grandson and Facebook. I looked at the android tablets, used MacBooks on eBay for $300 etc. But when I stumbled on this for $199 at bestbuy.com, it seemed like a no brainer to pick it up. At $200 it is currently the best value in ultra-portable touch screen Windows 8 laptops out there.It's just the laptop and power adapter in the box. The shape of the black power adapter closely resembles that of an iPad charger. At its thickest point it's about 1" thick and weighs 2 lb. 15.5 oz. - a little more than what's advertised on asus.com - 2.73lb.You get a standard HDMI port, 1 USB 3.0 port and 2 USB 2.0 ports, a 100Mbps NIC, 600Mbps 802.11n Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0 and a headphone/mic combo jack, an SD/MMC Reader. No Optical Drives.The CPU is probably the one component that will make most buyers hesitant. But with a Passmark Score of 1464 its similar to Core 2 Duo and some current generation mobile core i3 CPU. Supports VT-x, so you could even run VMware workstation on it. Graphics is the integrated Ivy Bridge Intel HD 2500. Supports DirectX 11, Shader version 5.0 and openGL version up to 4.0. According to benchmark sites, today's games can be played at the lowest settings smoothly. Has a 3DMark score of 340, compared to a NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650's 2860 - well this low end gaming card itself costs $105, when this whole laptop cost me $199. I don't play any games, but this isn't a gamer's laptop anyway. HD Videos played fine without any lags. Streaming media also worked without any problems. The touch screen is very responsive which really surprised me. I was expecting something sluggish. I found the keyboard to be very responsive, the touchpad on the other hand I was not too thrilled about - no problems, but the surface kind of feels funny, it doesn't feel like your typical laptop touchpad. I have not tested the HDMI out, since I will never use it. I didn't notice any heating problems while using it.I was also surprised that there were not that many bloatware, removed whatever was there and then I updated to Windows 8.1, took a while, but completed without any issues. For an UEFI boot, it's relatively slow. Opening and closing programs is fairly smooth. Watched a movie from Amazon Prime - smooth video and audio. Installed Libre office - works just great. Next on my list to do is to create a recovery media - it's going to take at least 16GB....Overall, I am very pleased that I was able to get this deal before it expired (which typically always happens with me). If you want a lightweight laptop for light use which is inexpensive - this is it! Even the chrome books cost more than this! Great job Asus!

Reviews.Title: Light and thin laptop acts like a tablet-plus
Reviews.Author: Joanna Daneman
Reviews.Content: This is a surprising bargain for the price and may work for people at home as well as those on the road. I was looking for something more-than-a-tablet-less-than-a-laptop for travel, especially for uploading photos. While the Kindle and other tablets work exceedingly well for travel access of the internet via Wifi, they have limitations.This is basically designed for internet, social media connections, media playback, wifi, Skyping (has a webcam) and portability.Good Points:Lightweight:3 lbs. Heavier than a tablet, but still lightweight.Thin: barely an inch and a quarter thick. Not the thinnest on the market--you can find 1/2 inch thin laptops, but you'll pay more.Touchscreen: I admit to finding the touchscreen on tablets convenient. When you go between a standard laptop and a tablet, sometimes you miss the quick touch-and-go feature of tablets.Keyboard--for emails and journaling, while you can become very adept at touchscreen typing (especially with predictive text) a keyboard is faster, especially for those of us who touch-type.  Definite advantage over tablet.Stereo SpeakerWifi w BluetoothHDMI port3 USB portsGigabit Ethernet Lan portCard readerWebcamMicrophone-headphone jackNot-So-Good:1. CPU is the Intel Celeron 1007U dual-core 1.5GHz . This is an "entry-level" CPU. The differences between a Celeron and a standard Pentium CPU are cache memory and bus speed, which mean little if you are a casual PC user but do affect performance. Here's the issue: if you have a resource-heavy application (like video editing software) this CPU could hold you back.If you were intending to edit videos while traveling--I'd say, this isn't your best choice. It will handle playback of media, but not intensive tasks like editing.Performance goes with gaming. Older games may be playable. Newer games may not. Not your gaming choice.2. Small disk drive:  320GB hard drive. Not bad, but this probably wouldn't replace a home computer unless you are doing just light office work (email, documents, internet, some media.)3. No DVD read-write drive3. Battery life is not long--about 3 hours, but depends on what you are doing. Could be shorter.4. Screen is small--11.6 inches. If you were to give up the touchscreen feature, Asus makes a Asus 15.6" X502 Laptop Notebook, which is a similar model with a 15" screen.5. A newer version of this laptop is due out, with a 500GB hard drive, priced similarly. If hard drive space is important, you may want to wait.5. No DVD optical driveSummary: Good, cheap, light-duty laptop.  A great choice if you want a sort of tablet-laptop hybrid and you don't have issues with no DVD drive or need heavy CPU performance tasks.  Small screen. Models with 15" screen (not touch) or larger hard drive are available, or will be. Onboard accessories like mic, webcam, wifi, bluetooth make this suitable for connectivity while traveling.

Reviews.Title: Good price, otherwise so-so.
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I have been using this computer for several weeks. I wanted to get a very portable and inexpensive windows computer with a touch screen. The Centron processor is fast enough for my needs, and the memory and hard drive are fine. As I said, inexpensive and a good value in those matters.My problems tend to be with the quality and reliability of the user interfaces. The touch screen sometimes works properly, and often does not. The touch pad is also flaky. Sometimes one tap works, sometimes two taps work. For reliability I have to use the "mouse click" functions at the front of the touch pad. And when doing this, Asus's flimsy plastic construction shows. Frequently, when I press down on the front edge of the touch pad, the plastic frame seems to bend a bit, which often causes the cursor position to shift. This flimsy construction also frequently shows up when trying to use the touch screen. The keypad is generally good, but has this weird habit of suddenly (and for no explicable reason) suddenly moving me back to an earlier spot in the current line, so that I continue typing in the wrong place and have to redo the line. This has happened once while writing this review.So my 3 stars are for it being inexpensive and allowing me to get my work done, with some grumbling and correcting as I do it.

Reviews.Title: Great value for so much functionality at very light weight
Reviews.Author: Canary
Reviews.Content: Although I bought this ASUS elsewhere for $279, I came onto Amazon to see about buying another for my mom because it is the best value I have ever had in a computer -- and I have been buying them since the first IBM PC came out. Decided to share why it is so great. 1) It is a computer, not just a gadget. This is maxed out at 4 memory/500 hard drive which is great for my use -- Office applications such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint, simple games and music programs as well as streaming movies from Amazon Prime and Netflix. 2) At maybe 2 pounds, it is so portable. I use it constantly because it fits in my purse and the touchscreen is protected by the hard cover. Open the cover and it immediately displays the login screen. Close it and it goes into secure standby where power lasts a long time. It probably lasts 4 hours or so in continuous use -- I use my own rapid recharge device in the car to keep going all day. 3) The WiFi, webcam/microphone, HDMI, SD card and multiple USB ports give me everything I need except a DVD drive which is increasingly irrelevant as I use the cloud more. 4)  I can input with the touchscreen, keypad, and touchpad. I also can choose to write on the screen or use my voice if I don't feel like typing, although those methods aren't as perfect. 5) Customer service via phone is adequate. The rep determined my first ASUS was defective through a few quick questions and told me to take it back to the store for exchange. The replacement ASUS came up immediately showing Windows 8.1 (which is better than awful Windows 8).  After I entered my MS account info, the system automatically and quickly  installed my applications -- even my wireless home printer driver. No downloading and installing at all on my part. 6) Never discount the envy factor. Two of my iPad-owning buddies have admitted they feel rooked when they consider what I paid for so much more power.

Reviews.Title: Bought it in love with it, this replaced my toshiba 15.6,
Reviews.Author: jorge
Reviews.Content: Love it, compact, great keyboard, super fast, enough memory, touch screen, best in its class for its price, paid $299 very happy

Reviews.Title: A great little machine
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jrpasley"
Reviews.Content: We now have three of these.  For the price they are amazing.  I bought the second and third after I had used the first and realized how much difference touch makes in a Win 8.x laptop.  I decided to replace all our family's laptops with touch screen devices.Pro -- Good screen with excellent touch capability- Small size, light weight- Plenty fast for MS Office (where touch is surprising helpful), Quicken, Evernote, web browsing, Netflix, YouTube, etc.  Not tested for heavy gaming.- Fast boot- Good battery life while asleep - can be used intermittently for a whole day- Useful ports.  HDMI, USB, PC video, headphones- Bluetooth- Sufficient disk for all my files to be local when the web/cloud is not availableCon -- Battery lasts 2.5 hours under "normal" use for me, which includes the apps above plus background cloud sync, email refresh, etc.  I wish it lasted 8 hours or better, but it appears that will not be happening until 256G+ solid state drives are cheap and common. However, it is still long enough to be useful.Comments -- We also have a larger (15.4") touch laptop.  It is used mostly for SmartDraw and Mind Manager, where the 11.6" screen seems a tad small, but the little Asus machines also run those applications fine.  I use them for those apps when traveling.- The Metro apps are getting better and have a very friendly interface.  They are nice on a small screen.- The touch pad is different than most I have seen.  The whole pad moves when you click.  Not a problem, but a little practice was required for me.- A phone with a screen large enough for web browsing and light data entry along with one of these machines covers 95% of the situations where I would use a tablet.  When I have to lug something around I get more value for my trouble with one of these machines (plus a phone) than a tablet most of the time.- I also use this machine for at least 80% of the situations where I need a laptop.  The screen is big enough for most things (although much smaller would not be) and the small, light form factor is nice.

Reviews.Title: not functional.
Reviews.Author: dc mom "dc mom"
Reviews.Content: I chose this product because it was cheap.  But the position of the mouse/touch pad is terrible - it is so large and sensitive that even the slightest touch from my palm when I am typing will change, delete, close what I am doing, also often it will shrink or enlarge the screen size.  The pad is just too sensitive.  It is so frustrating and really inefficient, I end up spending at least triple the time with a task because of the constant corrections I need to make.

Reviews.Title: The ASUS X200CA is a simple, commodity-level, good little laptop
Reviews.Author: Markbc
Reviews.Content: I bought this almost on impulse -at BB on Black Friday for $246. A good price, but I can see it was not the best price! I was actually looking for a  small windows 8 tablet, but this seemed better at the time, and I am glad I chose it.It does have a bit of a light or flimsy feel to it that worried me, but actually it is built surprisingly well. I was concerned that it would not hold up, but I took it on a 40-day trip and vacation to three different locations (via air and car) and it held up quite nicely.I loaded my copy of MS Office on it, upgraded to Windows 8.1 and all was fine.  It starts programs slowly, I am used to faster machines!  However, once they load the computer runs well and does web browsing, word processing, spreadsheet work, adobe file reading/edits and even Amazon instant video (via web browsers) quite reliably.  Only about 2.5hours or so on battery -one time I got more than 3 but that was just word processing.The touch screen and the small size are very attractive as a travel machine.  I have used Win8 a bit before, but this was the first time I was "stuck with it" full time and it's fine. Lately, I actually have found myself reaching out to the screen to try and move something or chose something on other computers, but only to realize they are not touch screen!  So Windows 8 is ok ☺OK, others have mentioned the good and bad -and they are pretty accurate from my experience since last November.  It's a nice basic machine and that's it.  However, I'd like to mention one other thing.One thing I was not keen on is that the track pad driver for this Asus does not have a setting to disable left-right swipe motion. (or if it does, please let me know -I tore apart control panel looking at every mouse/touchpad option!)Anyway, why does this matter?Well, each time you use the touch pad to swipe, specifically from right to left (say you are moving between parts of a word doc, or a web page), when you make that swipe, up pops the "Charms Menu" (basically, the start menu) on the right edge and you need to make an additional touch inside your document with another tap to restore focus back on the document and put away the Charms menu.  I did not realize how often I used the touchpad to swipe r-t-l until this happened. It does become annoying.I researched and on some Windows 8 machines, you can simply disable the trackpad swipe motion (right to left) and not worry about it (You don't lose functionality since you can still touch the screen to pull up charms etc).  However, THIS Asus does not have that as a trackpad/mouse option.  (would be good if they updated their drivers to include it!).I web-searched: "disable touchpad swipe windows 8" or "turnoff trackpad swipe windows 8," and found a link that provided a short script -say three lines of text that you copy and save as a text file (filename.reg).  Create this text file, then click on it and after the script is written into registry (yikes!) you're done. Reboot and you've disabled the right-to-left swipe option pulling up the Charms menu.Trackpad still works to move around word documents or webpages, but now without any distraction. When I want the charms bar I just reach up and pull it out from the right. Perfect!So to sum up.  The ASUS X200CA is a simple commodity-level, good little laptop. If you want a super-duper does-everything laptop, this is not it. If you want a current (2014) netbook-type computer with Win8 that does the basics of computing for on the road or daily use; this will work (once you adjust that darn trackpad).  (I don't think I would pay more than $250 for it from any source, however).

Reviews.Title: Low Quality Parts Create Frustrating Experience
Reviews.Author: K. Suen
Reviews.Content: The keyboard simply cannot be used for regular typing and the touchpad is way too sensitive. The machine also had to be reformatted every few days. Worst computer I have ever bought.

Reviews.Title: Works Great and Delivered on time.
Reviews.Author: tommy
Reviews.Content: Just received a few days ago.The touch screen and mouse pad work together and I have not had the problems that some of the other folks have had.Wish it was a little faster but for the price I am not complaining

Reviews.Title: Screen self clicking
Reviews.Author: R. ZHANG
Reviews.Content: The laptop is ok overall if the screen does not have the problem. Light weight, small, battery life is only around 2 hours but more than enough for my needs. Havent test much because of the following issue.I spent several hours to update it to windows 8.1 and setup for my personal use. But after several hours of use I notice the screen self clicking problem at one single spot near the up left corner of the screen. I firstly noticed it when I was reading the news using the windows app. It randomly selected words in the article and get into the photo section without me clicking. I wasnt sure at the beginning but this computer can show a circle around where you touched the screen. I noticed today that a circle of that type appeared on that spot without me touching the screen. I only see it happened 5 times but it's convincing enough that at least the unit I received is defective. I am returning it and sadly amazon cann't do replacement otherwise I would give it another chance.

Reviews.Title: Perfect lightweight , inexpensive and fast enough
Reviews.Author: Trans127golf
Reviews.Content: I wanted a lightweight laptop to travel and my iPad wasn't cutting it for work related computing. At a couple of pounds and small footprint, its easy to pack and allows me to work remotely. I use it to remote into my desktop and the processor speed and screen resolution are just fine. For the price , good functionality and portability it gets high marks.

Reviews.Title: Fraude con esta laptos
Reviews.Author: Edduin
Reviews.Content: para mi fue un completo chasco, compre esta laptops ilusionado, que tendría un portátil de buen rendimiento, y cuando la recibo, resulta que no me trajo la factura, y la batería no funcionaba, es decir no agarra carga, solo la puedo usar cuando la tengo conectada al toma corriente, escribí al vendedor y resulta que dice que se venció el tiempo estimado, para mi es un estafador que sabia lo que hizo desde el principio, un estafador, no lo recomiendo, por personas así es que las personas dejan de comprar por Internet, el hecho de que no me enviara la factura solo lo vuelve mas sospechoso.inglishfor me it was a complete disappointment, will buy this excited laptops, which would have a laptop with good performance, and when I receive it, it did not bring me the bill, and the battery did not work, ie not grab load, only I use when I have it connected to the outlet, I wrote to the seller and it says that the estimated time for me is a con man who knew what he did from the beginning, a swindler, expired not recommend it for people so that people leave of Internet shopping, the fact that I did not send the bill only makes him more suspicious.

Reviews.Title: Compact
Reviews.Author: littledog
Reviews.Content: I love it. It's a laptop for ants, just what the doctor ordered.Pros:- I got this as a traveling servicemember. Sometimes you need every corner of your life small and transportable. This laptop meets the bill. Just %50 more expensive than my crap chrome book but actually more functional than an undersupported smartphone, even when I got my full desktop, I was still hooked on this little guy. Does the job without a hitch.- Touch screen. Yes.- Price. Yes.- Video games? Killing floor, Rome: Total War. Pretty high settings. Definite high resolution. Use that as your bench mark. I was surprised this little guy could play games at all let alone with relative ease.Cons:- Windows 8. Why? Just.. why? Why would you dumb down your OS for the sole purpose of making your tablets look better? Why?- Keyboard is not illuminated. Makes for a lot of squinting and bending into your laptop searching for F-whatever keys.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Hanadi AL-Bader
Reviews.Content: i liked it forthe good pricetouch screenlightweight to carry around everywherei can use ms officethe only bad thing is very short battery life.

Reviews.Title: Cheaper Version
Reviews.Author: Heather J.
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this exact computer in January for $320 and loves it for the price. I needed a new cheap computer to drag around with me to work sites and decided to get the same one. This one is constructed out of different materials. The touch pad is very unpleasing to use and system gets hung up even with nothing on it. I'd return it if I hadn't thrown away all the packaging.

Reviews.Title: Very nice unit...Good value for the money
Reviews.Author: OPT
Reviews.Content: This unit is small, lightweight but still has a good display and is very readable.  You wont be doing any desktop publishing, media editing or serious gaming  on this unit but for basic office productivity and causal home use it is great.  It also is touchscreen and the touch is sensitive (but not overly so as to avoid false inputs).At this juncture the battery life is fine and it can remain in standby mode for several days without discharging.While the lack of a DVD drive can be slightly inconvenient for loading legacy program, if you can live without that or are primarily cloud based you will find this unit a great value.

Reviews.Title: expectations met.
Reviews.Author: Kerry Davis
Reviews.Content: This product was exactly as I expected it to be.  Everything seems to be working,  although the applications don't make up for the desktop experience.

Reviews.Title: Perfect companion for Highschooler's desktop...
Reviews.Author: my girls' mom
Reviews.Content: My high school daughter's taking college classes at the local university and needed a nice, portable computer to take with her. I purchased this Asus at Bestbuy on a whim and couldn't be happier! The screen size is a bit small for my old eyes, but perfect for her. She's able to carry it in a small bookbag with ease.This laptop is not meant to do heavy lifting like Photoshop or major gaming, though it runs all the office programs of OpenOffice.org perfectly fine. (A free/open source program that beats the heck out of MS Office.) The high school requires a google drive account and this laptop is well-suited for it, too.The only cons are with Windows 8 -- which are only cons if you live in an area like ours where there's no luxury of high-speed internet (SE Ohio): You'll need to uninstall all of the pre-loaded aps so they don't eat your bandwidth. You'll also need to make sure all automatic updates are turned off. Another quirk of Windows 8 is that when you close an ap, they really aren't closed so you have to open task manager to kill them.  My new laptop runs Windows 8 (and I find myself using my old Windows 7 laptop more than my new) and when I turn it on I instantly hit the windows-key and "d" to bypass the whole ap screen altogether.Great little laptop at a great price!

Reviews.Title: It is great for what it is, work!.
Reviews.Author: Joel6960
Reviews.Content: I like its light weight, slim design, the touch screen, but the battery is discharged really fast, I like to carry 4GB ram because it makes no tasks remain to run them out. But as much as I battery lasts 4-5 hours, I would like to last a little more, so 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Kathy Holloway
Reviews.Content: This is a great computer for what I am doing.  It is super fast and very responsive.  If you are looking for a good laptop for school or basic functions this is it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Laura Jolly
Reviews.Content: This computer was everything I hoped it would be, I use it mostly for web browsing and papers for school! It's fast and the touch screen it amazing! Love it

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: nicolas
Reviews.Content: Great power and the cheapest one!!!! This computer is perfect for travel, is little but not so much, is fast, and have very good graphics!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: I have two ASUS Tablets and both broke down. So far this laptop is great. Very fast and easy to use. I upgraded to 8.1

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Manish
Reviews.Content: Its been 2 months i bought this lappy for my wife and she is really very happy.Best part is that this is so light and touch screen is awesome. This is exactly what I required.The only flip part is battery life which is around 2 hours and can be better so I give 4 star but in this value ~$300 this is the best.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Julio Harros
Reviews.Content: This computer is great its really small and you can take anywhere. The only thing wrong if you want to complain about something is the screen is sensitive but other than that its a great small working computer. Great price!!!! Good for college students and even high school students

Reviews.Title: New Laptop
Reviews.Author: Norma G
Reviews.Content: After researching and looking around, my husband and I decided on this new laptop.  Having to learn Windows 8, but....So far, so good!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing product
Reviews.Author: Promise Ufomadu
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop because it's portableAmazingLight ...And it also have a nice shapeThis laptop is awesome

Reviews.Title: Touchscreen stopped working in a month
Reviews.Author: Jia Liu
Reviews.Content: Buy a different brand, product is inferior.  Buying a touchscreen computer without the touchscreen working is like buying a bicycle with the pedals missing.  I'm certain that more problems will creep up over time.

Reviews.Title: The battery simply will not hold the charge
Reviews.Author: Eli contreras
Reviews.Content: So I purchased this for simple stuff, writing paper, music, social network stuff. Everything about this little device is great except that it won't work unless its plugged in, The first time I got it I figured it was a fluke, however I just got the replacement and SAME PROBLEM. Needless to say I'm returning it.

Reviews.Title: Should have done my research on product.
Reviews.Author: WebOne
Reviews.Content: Mad at my self for not spending a little more money for cd drive and more memory. Better luck next time.

Reviews.Title: Extremely lightweight
Reviews.Author: A. Patkar
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these 2 months ago and have had no issues so far. They are extremely light and fast enough to not lag while doing basic tasks like using office or playing videos. The touchscreen is actually great and although that wasn't a factor in me buying this laptop, I find myself using it more and more. The only thing that I feel its missing is a backlit keyboard. I got this for $280 and for that price it might very well be the best value for money laptop in the world.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Bernard
Reviews.Content: IF ONLY TO WORK IN OFFICE OR AT HOME, AND EASY TO CARRY, THIS LAPTOP IS EXCELLENT.. IS FAST AND LIGHT

Reviews.Title: great computer
Reviews.Author: James T. Smith
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a small fast simple computer for around $300 this is it. I like the size easy to use features, does all the basics you will ever need.

Reviews.Title: Laptop
Reviews.Author: Alfred Haraldsen
Reviews.Content: I like the PC itself no complaints but the software took a little getting use toI still don't know how to sync my calendar to my smart phone all the addresses and task I had no problem with

Reviews.Title: asus computer
Reviews.Author: Joni L.
Reviews.Content: small enough, once i figured out what i needed on it, works fine.  very happy with my choice.  would recommend to buy.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Julie Wills
Reviews.Content: Love the speed, the size, the sensitivity of the touch screen. One of the best laptop keyboards I've ever worked with. Doesn't slow down my 107 wpm at all. Wish it had a better battery life (about 2 hours) and that it didn't have smart gesture on the touch pad. Who needs it with the touch screen anyway? All it does is cause me to try to move across the screen and accidentally bring up the home menu around half a dozen times or more a day. Other than that, it's a fantastic product and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: So close...and yet So far
Reviews.Author: Jed B. Tucker
Reviews.Content: Great concept but this little guy can't handle the applications it's loaded with.  I suppose it's the processor that's the real problem.  It simply moves at the speed of a machine from the late '90s, and hangs up frequently.  I only had it for a few weeks before returning so I can't talk about all the ins and outs, but I used it long enough to reveal its fundamental weakness.I read some of the other reviews, which lead me to make the purchase.  I suppose they're from people who still think (or ever thought for that matter) that AOL was a good way to be on-line, rather than recognizing it as the diminishing, useless, filter that it is.The touchscreen is a great feature, Windows 8 seems pretty cool, and the size is great - I'd try this concept in another machine - but this one is a paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Good for the Value
Reviews.Author: Byron K. Rashed
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my company's trade show booth do online demos, etc.. Here are my pros and cons:PROS:1. Nice size, small and compact2. Crisp, clear display3. Lots of RAM4. Stylish5. Plenty of access ports, HDMI, USB, etc.6. Nice design and overall layoutCONS:1. Windows (not an ASUS issue)2. Keys feel cheap3. Mousepad feels flimsy and slow response4. Heavy for the size, my ASUS Seashell is much lighter5. Battery life is not long unless I have a defective batteryOverall, it's a nice little laptop for the money if you don't want to spend a lot of $$. I am mainly a Mac user now and there is a huge difference, but at 4x or more the cost :)

Reviews.Title: Asus laptop
Reviews.Author: evan rosen
Reviews.Content: Great laptop all the features including a touch screen and windows 8 at i/2 the price. very fast shipping . would definitely order again

Reviews.Title: Small , Good for social networking
Reviews.Author: Eduardo G Montoya
Reviews.Content: This is a small laptop that you can use as a tablet. Its fast and W8 id very friendly. What I didn't like is that the mouse pad is very sensitive and takes you out of the application you are using. I had to change the windows setting so that you can no longer go to your previous applications just by sliding the screen from the left side. Other than that performs very well and the video camera is very good.

Reviews.Title: a good laptop for its price
Reviews.Author: David T. Yu
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop because it has a good price and for its lightness.  It is not disappointing. The only drawback is that it does not come with a DVD drive.  Most people would have to buy a usb dvd drive to load in softwares from DVD or to watch DVD movies.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Dawson
Reviews.Content: this laptop works great i havent had any problems and ive had it for about 2 months and a great price to if you are tinking about getting then get it now the touch screen also works great

Reviews.Title: Excellent touchscreen for the price...
Reviews.Author: AntJustAnt "antmon"
Reviews.Content: Pros - quick, nice responsive and bright touch screen, plenty of  ram, plenty of hd space, runs 1080p without a hitch, lightweightCons - not really a con but Win8 takes a few mins (yes, only a few mins) to get used to...just think to use it like you do your phone, tablet, etc for the tilesPurchased from BB a few days after Turkey Day '13 for $199 - why the heck is it $300+ now?

Reviews.Title: great computer!
Reviews.Author: Caleb
Reviews.Content: Really fast and touch screen feature is amazing! I would buy this again in a heart beat, at $300 you cant beat that price for a great laptop.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Cohen
Reviews.Content: my 11 year old loves this laptop, I would highly recommend, good quality, has nice features, operates as it should

Reviews.Title: Goog
Reviews.Author: ibrahim abd rabbo
Reviews.Content: Yes this laptop was nice as i expected - size and package and smooth touch screen - operating system all are good

Reviews.Title: Packs a Punch!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing device for teachers--compact, touch-screen, all the necessary ports and a sleek style.  You can read the technical details for yourself, this is not a computer for gaming or over graphic-intense operations.  However, it was a crisp and clear display and had everything a teacher needs!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: ashley Delgado
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend and it arrived on time she loves it like crazy it is a great gift to anyone

Reviews.Title: Good value until the newer machines with APUs arrive
Reviews.Author: Aj
Reviews.Content: Overall, for around $300 I found this machine to be a good value, the touch screen makes Windows 8.1 usable.I have several these and use them as remote servers for digital signage.  They play HD video nonstop 24hrs a day and are kept in a steel lockbox with little ventilation.  Despite the tough conditions they've performed perfectly month after month.
